generator: { queen(R,C) : pos(R), pos(C) } = N :- N = #count { I : pos(I) }.

hard_constraints.description: Business policy mandates that no two queens occupy the same row to prevent horizontal conflicts and ensure regulatory compliance.
Organizational compliance requires that no two queens are positioned in the same column to avoid vertical operational overlaps.
To maintain system integrity, rules prohibit placing multiple queens on the same ascending diagonal, as this violates board security protocols.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- queen(R1,C1), queen(R2,C2), R1 < R2, R1 + C1 == R2 + C2.

hard_constraints.description: Standard operating procedures dictate that no two queens can be located on the same descending diagonal to prevent potential collisions.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- queen(R1,C1), queen(R2,C2), R1 < R2, R1 - C1 == R2 - C2.
